results.title: Stimulus Offers $15 Billion in Relief for Struggling Arts Venues
results.byline: By Ben Sisario and Emily Cochrane
results.abstract: The coronavirus relief package that Congressional leaders agreed to this week includes grant money that many small proprietors described as a last hope for survival.

multimedia.caption: An empty United Palace Theater in New York. $15 billion of a $900 billion coronavirus relief package is designed to help the culture sector survive after a nearly yearlong revenue drought.

results.abstract: Not for decades have so many plays and musicals been turned into movies. But even in the best of the new crop, a lot gets lost in translation.
